intro: Gomphocarpus simplex, commonly known as the yellow owl's eye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive black center, resembling an owl's eye. The plant belongs to the milkweed family (Asclepiadaceae) and produces a unique fruit known as a follicle, which splits open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and savanna habitats. Gomphocarpus simplex is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
